isis.stitle: AIR CONDITIONING - HEATER SYSTEM: 5000i, 9100i, 9200i, 9400i, 9900i MODELS - Starting 03/01/1999 - REMOVE AND INSTALL - BLEND-AIR UNIT

warning.para: Before performing any of the following procedures, read the SERVICE WARNINGS. Failure to read the service warnings and to be aware of the dangers involved when working with refrigerant could lead to serious personal injury.

note.para: Most components can be serviced without removing the Blend-Air unit (see Figure 10). Do not remove the Blend-Air unit unless it is necessary for the service being performed.

step1.para: Make sure the key switch and A/C switch are OFF.
Close the heater water valves at the engine.
Recover the refrigerant from the Air Conditioning system. Refer to GROUP 16-AIR CONDITIONING THEORY, SYSTEM DIAGNOSIS AND SERVICE in the Master Service Manual.

warning.para: To prevent personal injury from hot coolant, do not remove the heater hoses from the heater core inlet and outlet until the cooling system has cooled down.

step1.para: Note how the heater hoses are connected to the heater core, and label the hoses for proper reconnection later. Remove the heater hoses from the heater core inlet and outlet tubes ( Figure 12).

figure.caption: Figure 12. Components Located Under the Cab

note.para: It is recommended that the heater hose inlet and outlet tubes be plugged or capped to prevent coolant from being released inside the cab during removal of the Blend-Air unit.

step1.para: Remove the plastic cover (three screws) that covers the high and low pressure switches on the expansion valve.

Remove the 10 mm nut that secures the refrigerant lines to the expansion valve and remove the refrigerant lines from the expansion valve ( Figure 12). Cap or plug all hoses. Place tape over the openings in the expansion valve.
If the expansion valve is being removed from the evaporator, refer to EXPANSION VALVE, Remove.
Remove the unit mounting stud nuts and washers ( Figure 12).
Remove the passenger seat.
Remove the passenger side floor panel, as follows:

step2.para: Remove the scuff plate from door sill ( Figure 13).
Remove the screws securing the floor panel ( Figure 14).
Take out the floor panel, exposing the air ducts ( Figure 15).

step1.para: Remove the sheet metal screws securing the air ducts at the Blend-Air unit ( Figure 15).

figure.caption: Figure 15. Air Ducts to Blend-Air Unit

step1.para: Remove the passenger side kick panel to gain access to the electrical harness behind it.
Disconnect the Blend-Air unit electrical harness from the cab harness located behind the kick panel ( Figure 16).
Note the placement of the clamps securing the harness between the Blend-Air unit and the electrical connector behind the kick panel; then remove the clamps.

Disconnect the Blend-Air unit electrical harness from the rear of the control panel ( Figure 17) by removing the control panel. Refer to AIR CONDITIONING AND HEATER CONTROL ASSEMBLY, Remove
.
Carefully lift the Blend-Air unit and remove it from the vehicle. The seal between the Blend-Air unit and the cab floor should come up with the Blend-Air unit.

figure.caption: Figure 16. Disconnect Blend-Air Electrical Harness from Cab Harness Behind Kick Panel
Figure 17. Disconnect Harness Connector from Cab Control Panel

svcsubproc.title: Install
svcsubproc.para: Position the Blend-Air unit housing assembly in the cab with mounting studs, tubes and pipes protruding through the floor.

step1.para: Install washers and nuts on the mounting studs ( Figure 18). Tighten mounting nuts to 22 to 28 lbf-ft (30 to 38 Nm).

Install the heater hoses on the heater core tubes making certain that the supply hose is on the inlet tube and the return hose on the outlet tube. The heater core inlet tube is the one nearest the center of the cab. Install the hose clamps ( Figure 18).
If the expansion valve must be installed, refer to EXPANSION VALVE, Install .

caution.para: In the following step, do not over-tighten the 10 mm lock nut. Too much torque will strip the threads on the stud, which will require replacing the expansion valve.

step1.para: Lubricate new O-rings with MINERAL-BASED refrigerant oil and slide them on both refrigerant line fittings that will be installed on the expansion valve. Position both fittings into the expansion valve openings. Slide the plate that holds the fittings in place onto the stud ( Figure 18 and Figure 7). Install the 10 mm lock nut and tighten to 80 to 90 lbf-in (9 to 10 Nm).
Check to be sure the low and high pressure switch electrical connectors are plugged into each switch.
Install the plastic cover (three screws) that covers the high and low pressure switches on the expansion valve.
Open the heater water valves at the engine.

Connect Blend-Air electrical wiring harness to rear of A/C and Heater Control Assembly ( Figure 17), and install control assembly. Refer to AIR CONDITIONING AND HEATER CONTROL ASSEMBLY, Install
.
Connect Blend-Air electrical wiring harness to the cab harness ( Figure 16).
Install clamps to maintain the original routing of the electrical harness between the kick plate and the Blend-Air unit.
Install the kick plate.
Secure the air ducts in place with sheet metal screws ( Figure 15).
Install the floor panel ( Figure 14).
Install the floor mat ( Figure 13).
Replace coolant lost during heater hose removal. Refer to the Operator's Manual for the correct type of coolant.
Evacuate and charge the air conditioning system as described in s16019, AIR CONDITIONING BASIC THEORY, SYSTEM DIAGNOSIS AND SERVICE in the Master Service Manual.

note.para: In the following step, to verify correct heater and A/C operation at the air duct outlets, the cover must be in place on the Blend-Air unit.

step1.para: Run the engine and check the system for leaks (coolant and refrigerant) and proper operation.
Install Blend-Air unit cover and passenger seat . Refer to BLEND AIR UNIT COVER, Install.
